Definition: Mean Body Mass Index (BMI) for men
Alias: Mean Body Mass Index (BMI) for men

Definition: Percentage of men with normal BMI (18.5-24.9)
Alias: Men with normal BMI (18.5-24.9)

Definition: Percentage of men who are obese according to BMI (>=30.0)
Alias: Men who are obese according to BMI (>=30.0)

Definition: Percentage of men who are overweight according to BMI (25.0-29.9)
Alias: Men who are overweight according to BMI (25.0-29.9)

Definition: Percentage of men who are overweight or obese according to BMI (>=25.0)
Alias: Men who are overweight or obese according to BMI (>=25.0)

Definition: Percentage of men who are mildly thin according to BMI (17.0-18.4)
Alias: Men who are mildly thin according to BMI (17.0-18.4)

Definition: Percentage of men who are moderately thin according to BMI (<17.0)
Alias: Men who are moderately thin according to BMI (<17.0)

Definition: Percentage of men who are thin according to BMI (<18.5)
Alias: Men who are thin according to BMI (<18.5)

Definition: Mean Body Mass Index (BMI) for women excluding pregnant women and women with a birth in the 2 months preceding the survey
Alias: Mean Body Mass Index (BMI) for women

Definition: Percentage of women with normal BMI (18.5-24.9)
Alias: Women with normal BMI (18.5-24.9)

Definition: Percentage of women who are obese according to BMI (>=30.0)
Alias: Women who are obese according to BMI (>=30.0)

Definition: Percentage of women who are overweight according to BMI (25.0-29.9)
Alias: Women who are overweight according to BMI (25.0-29.9)

Definition: Percentage of women who are overweight or obese according to BMI (>=25.0)
Alias: Women who are overweight or obese according to BMI (>=25.0)

Definition: Percentage of women who are mildly thin according to BMI (17.0-18.4)
Alias: Women who are mildly thin according to BMI (17.0-18.4)

Definition: Percentage of women who are moderately thin according to BMI (<17.0)
Alias: Women who are moderately thin according to BMI (<17.0)

Definition: Percentage of women who are thin according to BMI (<18.5)
Alias: Women who are thin according to BMI (<18.5)

Definition: Percentage of children underweight (below -2 SD of weight for age according to the WHO standard)
Alias: Children underweight

Definition: Percentage of children severely underweight (below -3 SD of weight for age according to the WHO standard)
Alias: Children severely underweight

Definition: Mean weight for age z-score for children according to the WHO standard
Alias: Mean weight for age of children

Definition: Percentage of children overweight for their age (above +2 SD of weight for age according to the WHO standard)
Alias: Children overweight for their age

Definition: Percentage of children overweight (above +2 SD of weight for height according to the WHO standard)
Alias: Children overweight

Definition: Percentage of men with completed secondary education
Alias: Men with completed secondary education

Definition: Percentage of women with completed secondary education
Alias: Women with completed secondary education

Definition: Percentage of the de jure population in the second wealth quintile
Alias: Population in the second wealth quintile

Definition: Percentage of the de jure population in the fourth wealth quintile
Alias: Population in the fourth wealth quintile

Definition: Percentage of the de jure population in the lowest wealth quintile
Alias: Population in the lowest wealth quintile

Definition: Percentage of the de jure population in the middle wealth quintile
Alias: Population in the middle wealth quintile

Definition: Maternal mortality rate for the seven years preceding the survey expressed per 1,000 women-years of exposure. Maternal deaths are deaths to adult females during pregnancy, delivery or in the 42 days following delivery, excluding those due to accidents or violence.
Alias: Maternal mortality rate

Definition: Pregnancy-related mortality rate for the seven years preceding the survey expressed per 1,000 women-years of exposure. Pregnancy-related deaths are deaths during pregnancy, delivery and in the two months following delivery, including deaths due to accidents or violence
Alias: Pregnancy-related mortality rate
